title: Tilapia Lamp

labels.content: Fish mummies were among the first kinds of animal mummies created by the Egyptians. The shilbe fish was associated with the goddess Hatmehit, whose name means “chief of the fishes.” And the tilapia fish represented fertility. Nevertheless, royalty could not eat fish, as the working class did, because according to myth, fish nibbled at the body of the drowned Osiris before his resurrection in the next world.

collections.name: Egyptian, Classical, Ancient Near Eastern Art

exhibitions.title: Soulful Creatures: Animal Mummies in Ancient Egypt
